column1: After Burner (Japan
column2:
USA)>After Burner>1995>ESRB - E (Everyone)>SEGA>SEGA>Action>3.5>1 Player>Afterburner is a conversion of the arcade game of the same name. The goal is simple: use your F-14 Tomcat and shoot as many enemies as you can. This aircraft has two weapons: lock-on missiles and Vulcan cannons (basically machine guns). In some versions there is an option to let the cannons shoot automatically all the time.
The game is viewed from behind the plane with you fighting wave after wave of enemy fighters. But at heart it offers the usual shooter mechanics
column3: meaning you spend most of your time dodging and shooting. Sometimes you come across a friendly supply plane and if you dock with it you can replenish your missiles.

column1: Amazing Spider-Man
column2: The - Web of Fire (USA)>The Amazing Spider-Man: Web of Fire>1996>ESRB - E (Everyone)>SEGA>BlueSky Software>Action>2.9>1 Player>An electric plasma grid has left New York in a state of chaos
column3:
and only Spider-Man and Daredevil can save the city from total destruction.
Lead Spidey through side-scrolling levels filled with a range of enemies and puzzles and take on HYDRA
column4: the source of the evil
column5: head on.

column1:
BC Racers (USA)>BC Racers>1995>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Front Street Publishing>Core Design>Driving>2.7>1-2 Players>BC Racers is a kart racing game starring characters from the Core Design's Chuck Rock series of games.
Each of the racers in this game rides a prehistoric motorcycle with a side car. On each two-character team
column2: one person drives the motorcycle
column3: and the other fights off opponents using clubs
column4: punches
column5: kicks
column6:
etc.
Graphics in BC Racers consist of a flat landscape decorated with scaled sprites to compose the track and scenery.

column1: Blackthorne (USA)>Blackthorne>1995>ESRB - T (Teen)>Interplay>Blizzard Entertainment>Platform>3.5>1 Player>Blackthorne is an action-adventure game that takes place on the planet Tuul. Tuul was a peaceful place
column2: until the evil warrior Sarlac used the power of the Darkstone to take control. Blackthorne's father
column3: the good King Vlaros
column4: sent him to Earth just as his kingdom crumbled around him. Now
column5: 20 years later
column6:
Blackthorne is grown and must return to Tuul to free it from the clutches of Sarlac.
This game is played from a side-view with non-scrolling backgrounds. It has strong similarities to Prince of Persia
column7: except you battle your foes using guns and bombs instead of a sword.

column1: Brutal Unleashed - Above the Claw (USA)>Brutal: Above the Claw>1995>ESRB - T (Teen)>GameTek>GameTek>Fighter>2.9>1-2 Players>As with the original Brutal: Paws of Fury

Characters each have their own fighting style
column3: array of moves
column4: and storyline. As you progress through the game
column5: you unlock more moves for each character. There's also a progressive conquest mode which challenges you to take over the entire Brutal Island.

column1: Cosmic Carnage (Japan

The impact caused extensive damage to both ships. There were only 8 survivors
column3: 4 from each ship. What's worse
column4: there's only one escape pod. You control one of the 8 survivors
column5:
and have to finish off all the others to escape with your life.
The gameplay in Cosmic carnage is similar to Street Fighter 2
column6: but with a much slower pace. Some of the fighters can be customized with different armor combinations
column7: allowing them access to different special moves.

column1: Darxide (Europe)>DarXide>1996>ESRB - E (Everyone)>SEGA>Frontier Developments>Shooter>2.5>1 Player>One of the last 32X games released (and exclusively in Europe)
column2: DarXide is a 3-D space shooter
column3:
inspired in part by the arcade gameplay of Asteroids. It is one of the few 32X games to used texture-mapped polygons.
Players control a lone starship rushing to destroy oncoming asteroids and alien vessels before they annihilate defenseless human miners and colonies. Asteroids break apart into smaller rocks
column4: which much also be hunted down and destroyed. Aliens likewise arrive in larger
column5:
more dangerous vessels.
Asteroids broken down to their smallest size and then vaporized will sometimes drop shield or energy recharges
column6: to repair damage caused by laser blasts or collisions. New weapons can also be found. Players have a time limit to meet all objectives in a stage before they are forced to land and try again. The right side of the HUD shows asteroids remaining (and their approximate size)
column7: while the left shows the player's distance to their base (and so

column1: Doom (Japan
column2: USA)>DOOM>1994>ESRB - M (Mature)>SEGA>id Software>Shooter>2.7>1 Player>The Union Aerospace Corporation has been experimenting with teleportation technology on Mars' moons Phobos and Deimos. After early successes
column3: something goes wrong. It seems the scientists have opened a gateway straight to Hell. Phobos base is overrun with demonic creatures
column4: and the whole of Deimos simply vanishes. A squad of marines is sent to Phobos
column5:
but all except one are quickly slaughtered. It falls to the surviving marine to grab some guns and strike back at the demons.
id Software's follow-up to their genre-defining Wolfenstein 3D
column6: DOOM is another first person shooter: full-on action seen from the space marine's perspective. Like Wolfenstein
column7: the game consists of distinct episodes
column8: playable in any order. The first episode
column10: takes place in the Phobos base and is freely available as shareware. The full game continues on Deimos in The Shores of Hell and culminates in Inferno
column11: the final episode which takes place in Hell itself. Each episode consists of nine levels
column12:
one of which is a hidden level.
The basic objective in each level is simply to reach the exit. Since dozens of enemies stand in the way
column13:
the only way to get there is through killing them. Switches and buttons must be
pressed to advance at certain points and often color-coded locked doors will block the way - matching keycards or skull keys must be found to pass.
DOOM's engine technology is more advanced than Wolfenstein's
column14: and thus the levels are more varied and complex. The engine simulates different heights (stairs and lifts appear frequently) and different lighting conditions (some rooms are pitch black
column15: others only barely illuminated). There are outdoor areas
column16: pools of radioactive waste that hurt the player
column17: ceilings that come down and crush him
column18: and unlike Wolfenstein's orthogonally aligned corridors
column19:
the walls in DOOM can be in any angle to each other. An automap helps in navigating the levels.
Stylistically
column20: the levels begin with a futuristic theme in the military base on Phobos and gradually change to a hellish environment
column22: upside-down-crosses and portraits of horned demons)
column23:
hung-up mutilated corpses and the distorted faces of the damned.
DOOM features a large weapon arsenal
column24: with most weapons having both advantages and drawbacks. The starting weapons are the fists and a simple pistol. Also available are a shotgun (high damage
column28: but slightly inaccurate in longer bursts) and a plasma rifle (combining a high firing rate and large damage). The rocket launcher also deals out lots of damage
column29: but the explosion causes blast damage and must be used with care in confined areas or it might prove deadly to the player as well as the enemies. Two further (in)famous weapons in DOOM are the chainsaw for close-quarter carnage
column32: while taking some practice to fire correctly
column33: can destroy most enemies in a single burst. The different weapons use four different ammunition types (bullets
column36:
so collecting the right type for a certain gun is important.
DOOM drops some of Wolfenstein's arcade-inspired aspects
column37: so there are no extra lives or treasures to be collected for points
column38: but many other powerups are still available. Medpacks heal damage while armor protects from receiving it in the first place. Backpacks allow more ammunition to be carried
column39: a computer map reveals the whole layout of the level on the automap (including any secret areas)
column40:
light amplification visors illuminate dark areas and radiation suits allow travel over waste without taking damage. Also available are berserk packs (which radically increase the damage inflicted by the fists) as well as short-time invisibility and invulnerability powerups.
The enemies to be destroyed include former humans corrupted during the invasion
column41: plus demons in all shapes and sizes: fireball-throwing imps
column43:
pink-skinned demons with powerful bite attacks and large one-eyed flying monstrosities called Cacodemons. Each episode ends with a boss battle against one or two especially powerful creatures.
DOOM popularized multiplayer in the genre with two different modes: Cooperative allows up to four players to move through the single-player game together
column44:
while Deathmatch is a competitive game type where players blast at each other to collect 'frag' points for a kill and re-spawn in
a random

column1: FIFA Soccer '96 (Europe)>FIFA Soccer 96>1995>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Electronic Arts>Extended Play Productions>Sports/Soccer>2.7>1-4 Players>Aiming to be the first football simulation that is realistic in the true sense of the word
column2: FIFA Soccer 96 was extremely popular at the time of release. It was hailed as the first really successful FIFA release
column3:
and opened the way for yearly revisions of the concept.
There were a number of factors that made FIFA96 stand out from the crowd of other football sims. Firstly
column4: the game's commentary was revolutionary at the time -- the renowned British commentator John Motson comments all the incidents and happenings on the pitch in real-time. The ambient commentary is varied
column5:
and systems with more than the minimum memory level get extra commentary phrases.
The Virtual Stadium technology has numerous pre-defined camera angles. The game even has a SVGA mode for better-than-minimum system
FIFA96 boasts eleven leagues from all around the world
column6: ranging from the unknown players of the Malaysian league to the celebrated stars of the English and Italian leagues. 59 International teams are also featured
column7: and it's possible to match the teams you want to against each other through friendlies
column8: or you can also choose to play domestic tournaments or International ones such as the World Cup. If you're not satisfied with the composition of the various teams
column9: you can create your own dream team through the custom team creator.

column1: Golf Magazine 36 Great Holes Starring Fred Couples (Japan

column3: in 36 Great Holes the player takes control of 24 different digitized golfers - 12 males and 12 females - playing in 27 historic courses in the U.S. including Disney's Eagle Pines and Tidewater Golf Club
column4:
playing 36 authentic holes.
There are seven different modes (Stroke Play
column5: Tournament
column6: Skins
column9: Practice and Match Play) and three different types of golf club heads including wood
column10: metal and graphite. There is a battery back-up to keep track of 16 different categories of stats and does feature the voice of Fred Couples
column11: even though he is not a playable character.

column1: Knuckles' Chaotix (Japan

column5: as usual

column8:
when you play the game you are always attached to another character.
Although the basic gameplay of Knuckles Chaotix is similar to the Sonic games

column11: Espio the Chameleon and Charmy Bee. There also two characters whose sole purpose is to slow you down

column1: Kolibri (USA

the earth's crystal rockets to the surface and empowers Kolibri with the abilities he needs to defeat the dark crystal.
This game features 19 levels set in a variety of detailed natural settings. Your goal in some levels is to destroy enemy bugs

column1: Metal Head (Japan

and you have to use all the weapons at your disposal to take out the terrorists.

column1: Mortal Kombat II (Japan

To win the main tournament

column1: Motocross Championship (USA)>Motocross Championship>1994>ESRB - E (Everyone)>SEGA>Artech Studios>Motorcycle>2.9>1-2 Players>Motocross Championship is the only dirtbike racing game for the 32X. The action takes place from a behind-the-bike perspective

The Tournament Edition ups each team's roster to three players

1. "Hot Spots" are randomized zones on the court that reward extra points (up to a 9-point shot!) for making a basket while standing within them.
Powerup icons appear randomly

or a bomb that knocks all other players to the ground.

"Tournament Mode" disables all other modes

column1:

column1: Zaxxon's Motherbase 2000 (Japan
